definition: former husband/widower
widower
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)
husband/man/manual worker/conscripted laborer (old)

sentences.english: The sympathetic widower who doesn''t have time to date because he''s raising a kid.
sentences.chinese: 有同情心的鰥夫，因爲要撫養孩子而沒時間去約會。

sentences.english: Even elderly widows and widowers choose to live on their own.
sentences.chinese: 連年邁的寡婦和鰥夫都選擇獨自生活。

sentences.english: There are legions of lonely widows and widowers in America.
sentences.chinese: 在美國有衆多孤獨的寡婦和鰥夫。

sentences.english: George was a widower with six young children.
sentences.chinese: 喬治是個帶着六個小阿子的鰥夫。

sentences.english: I am 80-plus and have recently become a widower.
sentences.chinese: 我80多歲了，最近剛成爲鰥夫。

sentences.english: The widower sat casting sheep's eyes at a half- caste girl all the evening.
sentences.chinese: 那個鰥夫整個晚上坐着向一個混血少女以目傳情。

sentences.english: Maybe he’s widowed and dating a Thai woman?
sentences.chinese: 要麼他是個鰥夫正在約會泰國女人？

definition: rather die than submit (idiom)
to rival sb for the affection of a man or woman/to be jealous of a rival in a love affair
harmful teachings/evil doctrine
to boast shamelessly/to talk big
scoundrel/rogue/bully/villain
lit. dressed up animal (idiom)/fig. immoral and despicable person
to slander/to smear/to vilify
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
devotion to righteousness that inspires reverence (idiom)
to ridicule/to mock
to kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
a golden house to keep one's mistress (idiom); a magnificent house built for a beloved woman
the guilty party files the suit/the thief cries thief
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
